title: Samsung Unveils New Galaxy S22 Smartphones at Unpacked Event, Keeps Old Prices
sub_head: South Korean tech giant hopes to woo a wider range of buyers by holding prices steady despite rising costs
body:
SEOUL—The world’s largest smartphone maker is answering a year of rising inflation and increasing component costs with a tactical move: holding down prices.
In the industry’s first major launch of the year, Samsung Electronics Co. introduced three versions of its flagship Galaxy S22 devices on Wednesday. The prices remain the same as last year: the base model will retail for $800, while the larger Galaxy S22+ will cost $1,000. The top-of-the-line Galaxy S22 Ultra, featuring a 6.8-inch screen and an “S Pen” stylus, is priced at $1,200.
